sources.title: The Woman of the Town (1943) CLAIRE TREVOR
sources.description:
FIRST TIME ON YOUTUBE!
Starring Claire Trevor, Albert Dekker, Barry Sullivan, Henry Hull
Directed by George Archainbaud
Oscar-nominated Music Score by Miklós Rózsa

There’s big trouble in Dodge City when Legendary lawman Bat Masterson (Albert Dekker) falls for a beautiful chorus girl (Claire Trevor) at the local saloon. He wants her to quit singing; she wants him to hang up his guns. But before they can ride off onto the sunset, Bat must deal with a violent rancher who is jealous of their romance. Super rare movie with a Super cast, initially released by United Artists.

sources.title: The Woman of the Town (1943) Classic Western | Full Length Movie
sources.description:
Bat Masterson's girl tries to get him to give up gunfighting and become a respectable journalist, but Bat has other problems - his rival is in town gunning for him.

Director: George Archainbaud
Writers: Norman Houston, Æneas MacKenzie 
Stars: Claire Trevor, Albert Dekker, Barry Sullivan 
Genres: Classics, Western

metadata.Plot: New York newspaperman Bat Masterson thinks back on his time as a lawman in Dodge City, Kansas, when he cleaned up the lawless town and loved a saloon girl named Dora Hand. Masterson's rival for Dora's love was a scofflaw named King Kennedy, who laughs at Masterson's attempts to establish law but grudgingly admires the way he goes about it. Kennedy's jealousy of Dora leads him into deeper conflict with Masterson, even as Dora tries to maneuver Masterson into leaving town and leaving the dangerous job of marshal behind.
metadata.Actors: Claire Trevor, Albert Dekker, Barry Sullivan
